textModule.text:
Lesson Contents
  • [[Functional Division of the Peripheral Nervous System|Functional Division of the Peripheral Nervous System]]
  • [[Structure of the Somatic and Autonomic Nervous Systems|Structure of the Somatic and Autonomic Nervous Systems]]
  • [[The Somatic Nervous System|The Somatic Nervous System]]
  • [[The Autonomic Nervous System|The Autonomic Nervous System]]
  • [[Opposing Action of the Two Divisions of the Autonomic Nervous System|Opposing Action of the Two Divisions of the Autonomic Nervous System]]
  • [[Comparison of the Autonomic and Somatic Nervous Systems|Comparison of the Autonomic and Somatic Nervous Systems]]
  • [[Lesson Report|Lesson Report]]

In this lesson, you will learn to:
  • describe the hierarchy in the peripheral nervous system (PNS).
  • define and describe the divisions of the autonomic nervous system (ANS).
  • explain the opposing (antagonistic) actions within the PNS, its motor system, and the ANS.

You should already know:
  • the basic structure of a neuron.
  • the anatomy of the nervous system.
